ETYMOLOGY: From Ancient Greek ἀριστοκρατία (aristokratía, 'rule of the best'), from ἄριστος (áristos, 'best') + κράτος (krátos, 'power, rule').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things; often refers to a concept or system in this usage.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A form of government in which power is held by a nobility or a privileged class.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种由贵族或特权阶层掌握权力的政府形式。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: In ancient Athens, the early form of government was an aristocracy before evolving into a democracy.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在古雅典，早期的政府形式是贵族政治，后来演变为民主制度。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things; refers to a group of people in this usage.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The highest class in certain societies, typically comprising people of noble birth holding hereditary titles or offices.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某些社会中的最高阶层，通常由拥有世袭头衔或职位的贵族组成。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The French Revolution fundamentally altered the power of the aristocracy in France.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 法国大革命从根本上改变了法国贵族的权力。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things; refers to a group defined by a quality in this usage.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A group or class of people considered superior in some respect because of their outstanding qualities or achievements.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 由于其卓越品质或成就而在某方面被认为是上等的群体或阶层。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Many believe that a true aristocracy of talent should govern, not one of birthright.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 许多人认为，应该由真正的才能贵族来管理，而不是依靠出身。
